titleStmt.title: Saint Petersburg, The National Library of Russia (Российская национaльная библиотeка), Marcel 30

respStmt.resp: Edited by Michael Marx in collaboration with Tobias J. Jocham et. al. TEI version created by Yasmin Faghihi and Huw Jones

msIdentifier.repository: The National Library of Russia (Российская национaльная библиотeка) , Saint Petersburg

summary.p: 15 fol. on parchment; Shelfmark: Marcel 30; Qurʾānic Text: Q 41:47-41:52, Q 42:28-42:30, Q 42:45-43:15; 5 lines per page; Dimensions: 300 x 210mm; Script style: kūfī D.III.
The fragments Marcel 26, Marcel 75 (NLR) and Arabe 349 (d) belong to the same manuscript.

This entry was created on the basis of the information made available by Valery V. Polosin (1939-2014), without use of manuscript images. Therefore, the exact distribution of the Qurʾānic passages across the manuscript pages is unknown to us, and all the passages are shown as belonging to fol. 1. The catalogue entry by Polosin contains the following information:
"Marcel 30
15 fol. 210×300 mm (1.42). Support: parchment of average thickness, transparent, of yellowish color, with traces of polishing. Writing material: dark brown ink.
Collation: two fragmentary and one full quire.
I: F1H F2H S F3H / S;
II: H4F / F5H (outer bifolium of the quire);
III: H6F H7F S H8F S H9F S H10F / F11H S F12H S F13H S F14H F15H.

Text layout: 100×187/190 mm (1.875), 5 lines. Ruling: absent. Script: D III. Diacritics: diagonal dashes in the same ink as the main text, used only in rear cases, only for the letters with dots under the line (mostly for the letter yā). Vocalization: red, blue and green round dots.

Verse markers: for individual verses – medallion above the line (type 3.D.II?) in gold and colors; for groups of five verses – medallions on the margins (type 3.D.II) in gold and colors, with the inscribed word خمس or خمس ايت, accompanied on the line with the golden letter ﻪ (hā); for groups of ten verses – large medallions on the margins (type 3.D.II) in gold and colors with the inscribed word عشر accompanied on the line with a small tear-shaped medallion (type 5.1.1) marking the border of the verse (fol. 14r); for groups of 50 verses – the word خمسون (“fifty”, the number of the last verse in surah 42 on fol. 10v) in a rectangular ornamented frame occupying the blank space of the line.

Title of surah 43 (الزخرف ثمنون و تسع اية) is written in gold and inscribed into an ornamented panel drawn in gold, red and green paint, with a full-blown palmetto on the outer margin outlined with blue paint (fol. 10v).

Inscriptions: all the sheets have marks on the upper margins with the surah numbers written in Roman numerals in brown ink; numbers of verses inscribed on the text lines with Arabic numerals; on some sheets the numbers of surahs and verses are written in pencil.
Stitching: fol. 1–3 are stitched with a pink thread; on the outer folds of quires there are traces of brown substance (leather?).
Defects: margins of fol. 1–3 are partly damaged, probably by rodents, with partial losses, and have grown dark (fire damage?).
Old accession numbers: B. 8 (according to Langlois’ inventory).
Contents:
Fol. 1r–3v. Surah 41, verses 47(47)–52(52). Incipit: [ما منّا] من شهيد . Explicit: عند الله [ثمّ كفرتم به] .
Fol. 4r–4v. Surah 42, verses 27(28) – 29(30). Incipit: [رحمته و] هو الوليّ. Explicit: مصيبة فبما [كسبتْ] .
Fol. 5r–10v. Surah 42, verses 44(45) – 53(53)*. Incipit: [عذابٍ] مقيمٍ.
Fol. 10v–15v. Surah 43, verses 1(1) – 14(15). Explicit: جعلوا له من [عباده جزًْا] .
Other fragments of the same manuscript: Marcel 26, Marcel 75 (NLR); Arabe 349d(?) (BNF)."
Olga Yastrebova has translated and sometimes corrected the notes of V. Polosin. Corrected passages are marked with ОЯ (O.Ya).
A detail image of a verse marker can be seen on the website of the NLR (No. 18).
